result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda K. Valliere

defendant.name: Valliere, Amanda K.
defendant.address: P.O. Box 443; 2854 Little Pines Road, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not possess any prescription only drugs without a valid prescription prescribed to her by a physician, Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:44 PM Defendant Amanda K. Valliere appeared by video, in custody, without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond.  Granted by Court.  Court amends cash bond to $1,000 with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises, Not possess any prescription only drugs without a valid prescription prescribed to her by a physician.  Bond form.

9:10 AM Defendant Amanda K. Valliere in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has contacted the PD Office. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Not possess any prescription only drugs without a valid prescription prescribed to her by a physician and maintain absolute sobriety.

1:32 PM Defendant Amanda K. Valliere appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Court reads charges. Attorney rights given. Defendant will be contacting the PD Office. State speaks to bond. Court authorizes $1,500.00 CASH with conditions: Not possess any prescription only drugs without a valid prescription prescribed to her by a physician and maintain absolute sobriety. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
